summary: This is an email chain from August 11, 2019, discussing procedures and records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, including details about suicide watch, psychological observation, cell assignments, and his last known status after a court appearance. It reveals internal inquiries about Epstein's cellmate history and the circumstances surrounding his first suicide attempt.

persons.name: Lt. Doctor
persons.context: A corrections lieutenant at the MCC who is providing information about Epstein's incarceration, cell assignments, and suicide watch procedures in response to internal inquiries.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at the center of the inquiries. The email discusses his cellmate status, a court appearance, his release from custody, and a previous suicide attempt.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: An inmate who was Epstein's cellmate during his first suicide attempt and with whom Epstein was subsequently not permitted to be cellmates.

connections.description: Tartaglione was Epstein's cellmate during Epstein's first suicide attempt, leading to a policy that they were not to be cellmates again.
Lt. Doctor, as a corrections lieutenant, was a source of information regarding Epstein's incarceration conditions and history.

events.title: Epstein's Court Appearance and Release
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had a court appearance and was subsequently released from 500 Pearl Street (a federal courthouse). His location was listed as unknown on the BOP webpage.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: A prior suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein while he was incarcerated, which occurred when he was cellmates with Tartaglione.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York (implied location of cells and procedures)
500 Pearl St., New York, NY (federal courthouse from which Epstein was released)
New York, NY 10004 (Office of the Inspector General field office)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was released from custody after a court appearance on August 9, 2019, and his location was listed as 'unknown' by the Bureau of Prisons.
Epstein had a prior suicide attempt while cellmates with an inmate named Tartaglione, after which they were not permitted to be cellmates again.
Internal questions were being asked about logs for 3:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m. head counts and the assignment of Epstein's last cellmate.
The email indicates there was no requirement for Epstein to have a cellmate at the time of these inquiries.
The correspondence is from the Office of the Inspector General, suggesting an internal review of Epstein's jail conditions was underway.
